Q.33. SUPPOSE THE JAPANESE WERE TO INVADE ALASKA OR START BOMBING ARMY POSTS IN ALASKA AGAIN. DO YOU FEEL THAT YOU HAVE HAD ENOUGH TRAINING ON HOW TO PROTECT YOURSELF*    1. I AM SURE I HAVE   2. I THINK SO BUT I,M NOT SURE   3. I DON,T THINK I HAVE   4. UNDECIDED   5. NO ANSWER 2 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.34. DO YOU FEEL THAT YOU AND THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT NEED MORE TRAINING IN HOW TO PROTECT YOURSELVES, LESS OF IT, OR ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT AS YOU ARE NOW GETTING*    1. WE NEED MORE TRAINING ON HOW TO PROTECT OURSELVES   2. WE NEED ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT AS WE ARE NOW GETTING   3. WE NEED LESS TRAINING ON HOW TO PROTECT OURSELVES   4. UNDECIDED   0. NO ANSWER

Q.35. WHAT KINDS OF TRAINING DO YOU THINK YOU AND THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT SHOULD HAVE MORE OF IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO PROTECT YOURSELVES AGAINST ENEMY ATTACK*    1. SMALL ARMS FIRING, USE OF SMALL WEAPONS - PISTOL, RIFLE, TARGET PRACTICE, ETC.   2. NOT CHOSEN

Q.35. WHAT KINDS OF TRAINING DO YOU THINK YOU AND THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT SHOULD HAVE MORE OF IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO PROTECT YOURSELVES AGAINST ENEMY ATTACK*    1. GUNNERY AND FIRING OF LARGER WEAPONS - MACHINE GUN, OUTFITS SPECIAL WEAPONS, ETC.   2. NOT CHOSEN

Q.35. WHAT KINDS OF TRAINING DO YOU THINK YOU AND THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT SHOULD HAVE MORE OF IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO PROTECT YOURSELVES AGAINST ENEMY ATTACK*    1. DEFENSE AGAINST AIR ATTACK - IDENTIFICATION OF PLANES, CAMOUFLAGE AND CONCEALMENT, COVER, DISPERSING, HANDLING BOMBS, ETC.   2. NOT CHOSEN

Q.35. WHAT KINDS OF TRAINING DO YOU THINK YOU AND THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT SHOULD HAVE MORE OF IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO PROTECT YOURSELVES AGAINST ENEMY ATTACK*    1. INDIVIDUAL HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT - RANGER, PHYSICAL TRAINING, COMMANDO TRAINING (EXCEPT WHERE EMPHASIS ON LARGE GROUP TRAINING) JUI-JITSU, PHYSICAL TOUGHENING, BAYONET PRACTICE, KNIVES, BOOBY TRAPS, GRENADES, ETC.   2. NOT CHOSEN

UNIT COMBAT TRAINING - TRAINING UNDER LIVE AMMUNITION, EXPOSURE TO FIRE, MANEUVERS, ETC., COMBAT TRAINING IN GENERAL   2. NOT CHOSEN CARD 2

V.109. LOCATION AND CAMP IDENTIFICATION: E. TEN INSTALLATIONS WERE VISITED AND 90 UNITS WERE SAMPLED. POSTS WITH LESS THAN 500 TROOPS WERE EXCLUDED AS WERE THOSE IN SOUTHEASTERN ALASKA WHERE LESS THAN 5% OF THE TOTAL TROOP STRENGTH WAS LOCATED. NONE OF THE ALEUTIAN POSTS SAMPLED WAS ADJACENT TO ANY KIND OF CIVILIAN COMMUNITY AND NONE HAD ANY WOMEN OTHER THAN A HANDFUL OF NURSES.     . MAINLAND - FT. GREELEY (A FAIRLY LARGE POST WITH KODIAK, A SMALL CIVILIAN COMMUNITY ADJACENT.)    . MAINLAND - NOME (A SMALL FAR-NORTH POST. THIS WAS A SMALL CIVILIAN COMMUNITY.)    . MAINLAND - FAIRBANKS (A FAIRLY LARGE NORTHERN POST, PRINCIPALLY AN AIR BASE. THE ONLY TROOPS THERE WHO WERE ALASKAN DEPARTMENT JURISDICTION WERE INFANTRY AND A FEW SERVICE TROOPS.)    . MAINLAND - FT. RICHARDSON (A LARGE GARRISON TYPE POST ADJACENT TO ANCHORAGE, A SIZEABLE CIVILIAN COMMUNITY.)    . MAINLAND - WHITTIER (A SMALL POST, PRINCIPALLY PORT ACTIVITIES. NO CIVILIAN COMMUNITY ADJACENT, BUT ONE COULD BE VISITED ON A THREE-DAY PASS.)    . ALEUTIANS - ADAK (A LARGE, WELL ESTABLISHED POST.)    . ALEUTIANS - ATTU (A LARGE, SOMEWHAT NEWER POST.)    . ALEUTIANS - FT. GLENN, SUBPOST (A SMALL POST WITH PRINCIPALLY PORT ACTIVITIES. REACHED BY A TWO-HOUR BOAT TRIP FROM UMNAK.)    . ALEUTIANS - FT. GLENN, UMNAK (ONE OF THE OLDEST ALEUTIANS POSTS, FAIRLY LARGE AND WELL ESTABLISHED.)    . ALEUTIANS - SHUMYA (A RELATIVELY SMALL AND NEW POST WITH PRINCIPALLY AIR CORPS ACTIVITIES.)
